result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Regalia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine, which includes the domestic abuse surcharge, to be paid in 90 days or serve 8 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A Regalia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David A Regalia in court with attorney Gregg E. Bridge.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant has completed treatment and the State moves to amend the charge to a forfeiture of disorderly conduct.  he Court amends Count #1, enter a plea of no contest and finds the Defendant guilty.   Count #2 was dismissed and read into Count #1. 
The Defendant was sentenced as follows:
Count #1:
FINE: $399.00 which includes the domestic abuse surcharge to be paid in 90 days or serve 8 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.

Defendant David A Regalia in court with attorney Gregg E. Bridge.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Attorney Bridge advises the Court the Defendant is currently enrolled in treatment and requests the matter be set for April    There is an offer to amend with completion of treatment. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David A Regalia in court with attorney Gregg E. Bridge.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has received discovery. Defendant needs to undergo counseling. Defense requests another date. Court will set a review date.  Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Gregg E. Bridge in court.   Defendant David A Regalia did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for a disposition date. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David A Regalia in court with attorney Gregg E. Bridge.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.

Defendant David A Regalia in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant stated he is represented by Atty. Gregg Bridge.  Hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.
